frame.name: Sufficiency
frame.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Item</fen> is located on a <fen>Scale</fen> relative to a critical value which is determined by some <fen>Enabled_situation</fen>. Generally, when the <fen>Enabled_situation</fen> is left unexpressed the <fen>Enabled_situation</fen> is interpreted to be the desirability of the <fen>Item</fen> being located within a particular range on the <fen>Scale</fen>. With many of the adjectives of this frame, the <fen>Scale</fen> is not explicitly mentioned; in such cases, the <fen>Scale</fen> is usually the quantity, incorporated in the meaning of the targets themselves, though in the case of <t>adequacy</t>, etc. the <fen>Scale</fen> referred to is quality.
<ex>I probably have <t>enough</t>. <fex name="Item">DNI</fex> <fex name="Enabled_situation">DNI</fex></ex>
<ex><fex name="Item">I</fex> was <fex name="Scale">mad</fex> <t>enough</t> <fex name="Enabled_situation">to scream</fex>.</ex>
<ex><fex name="Item">I</fex> was <t>too</t> <fex name="Scale">mad</fex> <fex name="Enabled_situation">to keep myself from screaming</fex>.</ex>
<ex><fex name="Item">I</fex> was <fex name="Degree">way</fex> <t>too</t> <fex name="Scale">hot</fex>. <fex name="Enabled_situation">DNI</fex></ex>
<ex><fex name="Item">The particles</fex> are <t>sufficiently</t> <fex name="Scale">small</fex> in diameter <fex name="Enabled_situation">that they may be considered points</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Item
FE.definition: <def-root>The entity whose scalar property is specified.<ex><fex name="Item">The light</fex> is probably bright <t>enough</t>.</ex><ex>I have <t>sufficient</t> <fex name="Item">paper</fex> for the purpose.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Scale
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Scale</fen> is the attribute of the<fen>Item</fen> that is being described.<ex>It was <fex name="Scale">hot</fex> <t>enough</t> to ignite the iron.</ex><ex>The workforce is <t>sufficient</t> <fex name="Scale">in number and proficiency</fex> to finish the building in minimum time.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Enabled_situation
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Enabled_situation</fen> by which the critical value is judged. <ex>Can He make a rock <t>too</t> heavy <fex name="Enabled_situation">for Him to lift</fex>?</ex> <ex>There's almost <t>enough</t> <fex name="Enabled_situation">for thirty people</fex>.</ex> <ex>That information <t>sufficed</t> <fex name="Enabled_situation">to convince me</fex>.</ex> <ex>Finding a parking spot is <t>sufficiently</t> difficult <fex name="Enabled_situation">that you'd do better to walk</fex>.</ex> <ex>This legislation was <t>inadequate</t> <fex name="Enabled_situation">in that it allowed many obvious delinquents to escape prosecution</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Degree</fen> frame element indicates a modification of the value indicated by the target.<ex>The spell was <fex name="Degree">almost</fex> powerful <t>enough</t> to destroy the demonic pumpkin.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Circumstances
FE.definition: <def-root>Circumstances describe the state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is specifically independent of the event itself and any of its participants. </def-root>

lexUnit.name: enough.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: as much or as many as is necessary or desirable

lexUnit.name: enough.adv
lexUnit.definition: COD: to the required degree or extent.

lexUnit.name: enough.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: as much or as many as is necessary or desirable

lexUnit.name: suffice.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: be enough or adequate.

lexUnit.name: sufficient.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: enough; adequate.

lexUnit.name: sufficiently.adv
lexUnit.definition: FN: adequately; with enough to meet the needs of

lexUnit.name: insufficient.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: not enough.

lexUnit.name: insufficiently.adv
lexUnit.definition: FN: without adequate power, capacity, or competence

lexUnit.name: adequate.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: satisfactory or acceptable.

lexUnit.name: adequately.adv
lexUnit.definition: FN: satisfactorily or acceptably

lexUnit.name: insufficiency.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the condition of being insufficient.

lexUnit.name: adequacy.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the quality of being just satisfactory or adequate

lexUnit.name: inadequacy.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a lack of the quality or quantity required; insufficiency

lexUnit.name: inadequate.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: lacking the quality or quantity required; insufficient for a purpose.

lexUnit.name: inadequately.adv
lexUnit.definition: FN: with a lack of the quality or quantity required; insufficienly for a purpose

lexUnit.name: plenty.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a large or sufficient amount or quantity; more than enough.

lexUnit.name: plenty.adv
lexUnit.definition: COD: fully; sufficiently.

lexUnit.name: plenty.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: more than adequate amount or supply

lexUnit.name: ample.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: enough or more than enough; plentiful.

lexUnit.name: too.adv
lexUnit.definition: COD: to a higher degree than is desirable, permissible, or possible.

lexUnit.name: so.adv
lexUnit.definition: COD: to such a great extent.
